titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the South African Poster Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King with staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:52

did.unittitle: South African poster collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of over three hundred posters and related oversized material which document the government and politics of South Africa, primarily from the era of apartheid to the first democratic elections open to all races in 1994. Many of the posters represent numerous political parties, organizations against apartheid, and voter education groups. The cultural life of the country is represented by materials pertaining to South African poets and artists.

langmaterial.language: The material is in English, Afrikaans, French, and Portuguese.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection, MS 605; African Postcard Collection, MS 1575; Pamphlet Collection, MS 1351; South Africa Collection, MS 1559; South African Apartheid Collection, MS 1500. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The photograph by James Blair in box 4, folder 11, for National Geographic may not be reproduced without permission from the magazine. Copyright status for the remaining collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: South African Poster Collection (MS 1574). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The posters are arranged alphabetically by organization name. A small section of poster-like materials, such as calendars, maps, newspapers, and photographs, are arranged by category, and alphabetically by organization or personal name within each category. Additions to the collection are arranged in a similar pattern.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The South African Poster Collection consists of posters and other oversized materials which document the political, social, and cultural life of South Africa, primarily from circa 1969 through 1994. The posters are arranged alphabetically by organization name. Additional oversized materials are arranged by category, and then alphabetically by organization name, personal name, or title within each category. Additions to the collection are arranged in a similar pattern.
Additional materials on South Africa are available in the following collections:
SOUTH AFRICAN APARTHEID COLLECTION, Manuscript group 1500
SOUTH AFRICAN HISTORICAL COLLECTION, Manuscript group 1556

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

did.unittitle: Inventory
Posters
Africa Fund [12 different posters on apartheid]
Africa Muslim Party (AMP) [2 different posters]
African Christian Democratic party (ACDP) [1 election campaign poster]
African National Congress (ANC)
ANC: 1912-1982 (South African Youth in Struggle)
Advance to National Democracy! [3 posters with different slogans marking 1990 as "The year of Peoples' Action for a Democratic South Africa"]
The authorized Madiba Collection [poster with pictures of silk and textile memorabilia for Nelson Mandela]
"After years of struggle.. now is the time for freedom!" [4 posters with different election campaign slogans]
47th ANC National Conference: Peoples Power for a Democratic Future
Christmas and Eid greetings cards [by ANC offering its goodwill and best wishes to South Africa and its peoples]
"Food for all: ANC demands lower food prices, no VAT on basics, drought relief for all"
The Freedom Charter [6 different posters]
"From Anti-apartheid to Pro-democracy" [3 posters with photos of Mandela and slogans supporting his presidential candidacy]
Happy Birthday! [signatures of several people wishing Nelson Mandela a happy and joyous 75th Birthday]
"I have got my ID.., get yours and vote for freedom!" [5 different posters calling voters to register]
Mayibuye (Journal of the African National Congress) [8 posters advertising various issues of the journal, 1991-1994]
Nelson Mandela for President: vote for Peace, Freedom and Democracy! [4 different posters in support of Mandela's candidacy for president]
Now is the time to... be informed, choose your representatives.. [29 different posters with quotes of ANC's political and economic agendas and names of 200 candidates for the National Assembly]
NP Rule= Disaster [6 posters with different messages and slogans opposing the National Party (NP) and its candidates]
Solidarity with ANC! [2 different posters]
Stop Savimbi's war! Recognise elected Angolan Government! [issued by ANC]
Tribute to Heros

Chris Hani, 1942-1993 [13 posters with different public messages and slogans published in commemoration of the assassination of Chris Hani (general-secretary of the South African Communist Party and member of the National Executive Committee of ANC) on April 10, 1993]
Oliver Reginald Tambo, president of ANC, 1969-1991 [8 different posters]
We salute our leaders [3 posters with photos of ANC founders and heroes]
We Demand... [7 differ posters with slogans demanding peace, freedom, democracy, interim government, constituent assembly]
Working together for jobs, peace and freedom [9 posters with different slogans conveying ANC's promise for "A better life for all"]
1984 Year of the Women [10 posters with different slogans and messages on Women and ANC in the struggle against apartheid]
1993 : Year of Democratic Election [4 [posters with different slogans in support of ANC]
Anti-Apartheid Movement [London and other countries]
Anti-apartheid calendar '88
Anti-apartheid slogans and messages [25 different posters published by trade unions and other anti-apartheid groups]
Isolate Apartheid, Sanctions Against South Africa [4 posters with different slogans calling for arms embargo and sanctions]
Concerned Nurses of South Africa [4 posters announcing founding conference, different slogans]
Conservative Party (CP/KP) [3 posters with different campaign slogans and candidate photo]
Convention for a Democratic South Africa (CODESA)
Democratic Party/Demokratiese Party (DP) [10 vinyl posters with different election campaign slogans and candidate photos]
Apartheid posters
Federal Party (FP)
Freedom Front/Vryheidsfront (VF-FF) [a slogan with photo of General Constand Viljoen]
Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) [15 different voter education posters]
International Defense and Aid Fund (IDAF)

Women's National Coalition (WNC) [8 different posters on women's rights issues]
Workers International to Rebuild the 4thInternational [Socialist Movement]
Announcement for a public speech to be held in Natal
Announcement for a public speech to be held in Salt River
Vote Workers International for a Revolutionary Workers Party, No Compromise Socialism Now [election campaign slogan]

American Committee on Africa. Published by the Committee in cooperation with the United Nations Centre Against Apartheid [each month contains a poster by a different artist on the theme of apartheid; text in English, French, Portuguese and Arabic]
"Congress of South African Trade Unions (COSATU): ten fighting years, 1985-1995"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One side has an image of Nelson Mandela; the other side an image of Thandiswa Mazwai, a South African musician, singer, and songwriter.

did.unittitle: "Making Peace Exhibition 2007: Two Presidents, Two Fighters, Two Peace Prize Winners"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poster has images of Nelson Mandela and Albert Luthuli, former presidents of the African National Congress and recipients of the Nobel Peace Prize. Making Peace , an exhibit of photographs and text, was launched at the Nelson Mandela Foundation, 2007.

did.unittitle: Additional Material

langmaterial.language: The material is in English or Afrikaans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are 32 posters from various groups documenting the 2009 elections, many in both English and Afrikaans. There are also five exhibition poster from the District Six Museum.
